newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling virtually unchanged on dollar.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling virtually unchanged on dollar.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling remained virtually unchanged against the dollar on Wednesday as the market waited in vain for dollar buyers, dealers said.
"Continuous inflows of foreign currency into the market saw the dollar bid price shift down as the market waited in vain for dollar buyers," a dealer at a leading bank told Reuters.

"A number of players started unwinding their long dollar positions as the market sentiment remained unclear -- though it could favour a stronger shilling in the short-term if prevailing market conditions continue," the dealer added.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a shilling mean commercial rate of 56.97 against the dollar compared to 56.99 on Tuesday.
Against the pound, the central bank posted a mean commercial rate of 89.345 compared to 88.95 on Wednesday.
